summary.para: This class is a replacement for the System.Configuration class built into the full .NET framework. We've implemented just enough to supply the needs of CAB.

There are basically two forms that an element can take: either a leaf node, which will have attributes, or collection, which contains child nodes. Leaf nodes should be subclasses of this class, whereas collections should be subclasses of ConfigurationElementCollection, which is a direct subclass of this class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement(System.String,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Called while deserializing a ConfigurationElement when it encounters an XML element that it doesn't recognize (for example, as a property of the subclass).
member.param: Name of the element that it couldn't find
The positioned on the unknown element.
member.returns: false indicates it is unknown and hasn't been read.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.OnDeserializeUnrecognizedAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an unknown attribute is encountered during deserialization.

member.param: The name of the unrecognized attribute.
The value of the unrecognized attribute.

member.summary: When your class is deserized from the configuration XML, the class will make sure this property is present in the data and throw an error if it isn't.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.CryptographyBlock
member.summary: This class helps manage data that needs to be encrypted and stored. When you encrypt data, you need to save the initialization vector along with the encrypted data (they key should not be store, or at least somewhere else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.CryptographyBlock.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm,System.Byte[])
member.summary: The constructor.
member.param: An instance of a symmetric algorithm that will be used to encrypt/decrypt data.
The key to use for encyrption/decryption.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.CryptographyBlock.Decrypt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a block of data that was originally encrypted with this class' method.
member.param: The block of data to decrypt.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if there is a problem with the encrypted data.
Thrown if the data supplied is shorter than the required header.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.CryptographyBlock.Encrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts a block of data and returns a block that includes a version number, the initialization vector, and the encrypted block.
member.param: The data to encrypt.
The initialization vector to use for encrypting the data.
member.returns: A block with all the data required to decrypt, except for the key.
member.exception: If one of the parameters is null

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.RijndaelConfigurationProvider
member.summary: This class supports configuration sections that have been encrypted with another program using the Rijndael algorithm.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider
member.summary: This is the base class for providers that can decrypt sections of the configuration XML. Right now the only subclass is .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: This method is called with the encrypted string and must return the decrypted string.
member.param: The encrypted string.
member.returns: The decrypted string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.RijndaelConfigurationProvider.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This class can be used by the class to decrypt encrypted sections of the XML file. You'll need to create an instance of this class and assign it to the property before loading any sections.
member.param: The key to use when decrypting data.
member.exception: Thown if the parameter is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.RijndaelConfigurationProvider.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: This method decrypts section data, which is saved in the XML file as a base-64 encrypted string.
member.param: The encrypted data, base-64 encoded.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if there is a problem with the encrypted data.
Thrown if the data supplied is shorter than the required header.

summary.para: The Compact Framework doesn't provide this class, which is in System.Configuration

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.DirectoryUtils.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Because the Windows Mobile doesn't have a current directory, this little helper method provides a way to get to the directory for this assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.GetSection(System.String)
member.summary: This method provides you access to a "section" of the App.config file. This is done with two pieces. First, a section element in configuration/configSections defines the type and assembly for a subclass of ConfigurationSection that can process the XML for a "section". Second, an XML node (with children) with the same name as the section that your subclass of ConfigurationSection will process.
member.param: Name of the section that we want to retrieve. There must be a matching <section> element under configuration/configSections, as well as an XML element with this name under the XML root, in the App.config file.
member.returns: A subclass of ConfigurationSection that you use to parse your custom section.
member.exception: Throws this exception if there was an error creating the instance of the section.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Mobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.ClearCache
member.summary: This method is provided primarliy to help with unit testing. It allows us to reload configuration data each time so we can check for errors that occur during loading.

member.returns: A new instance of the type.
member.exception: Throws this exception if the type string is null or empty. Or if there was an error creating an instance of the type.
